page.title: 01Armadale,Clan Donald Centre
page.content: Armadle, unusually for Skye, has a great variety of habitats from rocky shoreline, through broadleaved woodlands, conifer plantains and exotic gardens to open wet peat moorland. Armadale is the centre of the Clan Donal lands Trust, founded 1971 as a charitable organisation of worldwide MacDonalds that owns and manages 17000 acres of farmland, croftland and visitors centre based on the Castle. This is now mostly a sculptured ruin but one part houses the Exhibitin and audio visual show. The Stables, renovated 1984 at 1 million pounds has a Restaurant ad Shop. The Cente Gardens and Woodland Trails atrract 40000 people. The Trust employs 11 fulltime; director, assistant director, secretary, countryside
